benchmark_details.name: FedLLM-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: FedLLM-Bench is a realistic benchmark for Federated Learning of Large Language Models (FedLLM) that offers comprehensive datasets and establishes 8 training methods and 6 evaluation metrics to evaluate and enhance federated instruction tuning and preference alignment in real-world scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a realistic benchmark for evaluating Federated Learning methods in the context of large language models.

data.source: Four user-annotated datasets designed for Federated Learning: Fed-Aya, Fed-ChatbotIT, Fed-WildChat, and Fed-ChatbotPA.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on the evaluation results of the models tested on the datasets within FedLLM-Bench.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in terms of following user instructions and generating appropriate responses.
methodology.baseline_results: FedAdagrad shows the best average performance across the tested methods.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted to analyze the effectiveness of various federated learning methods on the provided datasets.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The datasets exhibit diverse language groups representing different demographics.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential for data leakage or exposure of sensitive information.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The datasets have been screened for personally identifiable information.
